eea.engine.action
Interface Action

All Known Implementing Classes:
ChangeStateAction, ChangeStateInitAction, DestroyEntityAction, MoveBackwardAction, MoveDownAction, MoveForwardAction, MoveLeftAction, Movement, MoveRightAction, MoveUpAction, QuitAction, RemoveEventAction, RotateLeftAction, RotateRightAction, SetEntityPositionAction
public interface Action

An arbitrary number of individual actions can be added to a given event. When the event occurs, all actions added to the event will be performed. Example actions change the state of the underlying or affected object, exploding an entity, or move/rotate/position the entity.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Alexander Jandousek, Timo Bähr

Method Summary
 void update(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc, org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sb, int delta, Component event)
          Any action has to implement the update method.
 

Method Detail

update

void update(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc,
            org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sb,
            int delta,
            Component event)
Any action has to implement the update method. This method updates the entities based on the underlying event, as determined using event.getOwner()

Parameters:
gc - the GameContainer object that handles the game loop, recording of the frame rate, and managing the input system
sb - the StateBasedGame that isolates different stages of the game (e.g., menu, ingame, highscores etc.) into different states so they can be easily managed and maintained.
delta - the time passed in nanoseconds (ns) since the start of the event, used to interpolate the current target position
event - the event that the action is registered for
See Also:
GameContainer
